conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 100 meters.
The graph shows the velocity of the skydiver over time, increasing from 0 to 20 m/s over the first 10 seconds.
The distance fallen can be found by calculating the area under the velocity-time graph from 0 to 10 seconds.
The graph shows a curve starting at 0 m/s and reaching 20 m/s at 10 seconds.
The area under the curve represents the distance fallen and forms a right triangle.
The formula for the area of a triangle is Area = 1/2 * base * height.
Calculate the area of the triangle with base as 10 seconds and height as 20 m/s.
The area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds is exactly 100 meters.
